headline: Uber Freight cuts jobs amid commercial reorganization
summary: Uber Freight confirmed a small round of layoffs this week tied to a commercial reorganization. The post Uber Freight cuts jobs amid commercial reorganization appeared first on FreightWaves.

headline: Former Northrop Grumman CEO Ronald Sugar And Ex-CIA Venture Chief Gilman Louie Join Ursa Major Board To Scale Hypersonic Defense Tech
summary: Ursa Major is ramping up production of hypersonic engines, solid rocket motors, and space-based defense systems for the U.S. military and allied forces. Now the Colorado propulsion manufacturer has recruited two influential figures in aerospace and national security to help accelerate that mission. The company announced on Oct. 2 the appointment of Dr. Ronald Sugar and Gilman Louie to its board. headline: Shares of This Food-Delivery Robot Maker Are Soaring. What DoorDash Has to Do With It.
summary: Serve will work with DoorDash to expand its footprint across the U.S., starting in Los Angeles.  Serve robots already have a presence in the city as well as in Miami, Dallas, Chicago, and Atlanta through an existing partnership with Uber Eats.  The agreement will DoorDash will expand the volume of orders available for delivery, the company added.

headline: This distributed data storage startup wants to take on Big Cloud
summary: Tigris has raised $25 million to expand its growing network of localized data storage centers — the storage layer for decentralized computing infrastructure.

headline: Delivery robot firm Serve Robotics partners with DoorDash to expand reach
summary: (Reuters) -Serve Robotics said on Thursday it is partnering with DoorDash to deploy its sidewalk robots to fulfill orders on the food delivery platform, in a move to capture more customers and expand its reach beyond Uber Eats.  The San Francisco-based robotics firm said customers ordering via DoorDash from select stores and restaurants in Los Angeles may have their orders delivered by a Serve robot, adding that it plans to expand its DoorDash deliveries across the U.S.  The tie-up with DoorDash, the top food delivery platform in the country, will help Serve increase the volume of orders available for its robots by tapping into merchants and customers who use DoorDash instead of Uber's food delivery app.
